turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about LJ Hooker League.
turn.1: What is the LJ Hooker League?
turn.2: LJ Hooker League The LJ Hooker League is a cricket competition on the NSW Far North Coast comprising teams from the Ballina, Casino and Tweed District Cricket Associations.
turn.4: The League was established in 1994/95 and superseded the top-grade of the Ballina, Casino and Lismore District Competitions.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: For 13 seasons this competition worked well, but a division came about in 2007 when the Tweed District Cricket Association asked to join the league to form a larger 16-team competition.
turn.7: Why did they reject the offer?
turn.8: The Ballina clubs voted unanimously to join with the Tweed based clubs, but this was rejected by the Lismore-based teams.
turn.10: The original league was dissolved and since 2007/08, the league comprises teams from Ballina, Casino and Tweed districts. Through the Far North Coast Cricket Council (region) and North Coastal Zone (zone), the LJ Hooker League feeds into Country Cricket New South Wales.
